Reviews.Title: “Return trip, just as good”
Reviews.Author: nameleftblank
Reviews.Content: Second trip to this hotel, as clean and comfortable as the first time. Larger room for this visit, with a work desk - along with free Wifi, practical for a day of work.

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance - tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Stu593
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent and the location is very convenient. There are no elevators, so you climb, with your bags up steep stairs. The bedding in the room is very tired, the covers and blankets look very old. Breakfast is very good. The owners need to invest in upgrading the bedding and the sagging mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Opinion depends on expectations”
Reviews.Author: lilacroller
Reviews.Content: Chateau Versailles is boutique hotel on fashionable Sherbrooke Street in Montreal. The hotel is pleasant if you are indifferent to : walking up a steep flight of stairs (possibly with luggage) to enter the main door and walk up flights of staris to get to your room. very small rooms without desks or easy access to wall outlets (not for working in room) improper function of simple amenities like a toilet. broken bathroom tiles, paint missing from spots old blankets, shabby bedspreads, tired curtains valet parking for $27 a night because there is no place to park bizarre modern paintings of nude females The hotel is pleasant if you like: to eat essentially a European breakfast in a comfortable gracious room, comfortable chairs and lovely ambience excellent pastries, fruit, cheesem cereals, and cold meats for breakfast enjoy a historical building with some lovely art of local scenes a bilingual staff dedicated to making you feel welcome wireless throughout a pleasant living room for easy sitting and reading a building reeking of interior architectural details the antithesis of cold, business-like hotels watching a varitey of people share a pleasant living room for breakfast a quick drive or slow walk to Montreal's lovely downtown district

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit overstated”
Reviews.Author: PierreTraveler
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying our stay at Chateau Versailles but have to say we were a bit under-whelmed after reading the website. Our room is nice, but not luxury by any means. The carpet has a frayed hole a few feet from the door. Bathroom is very small. Pillow top beds are very nice and staff is friendly. Afternoon tea is a nice touch in the common area and breakfast was fine, but not special. Location is quiet enough and central enough that it's easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little oasis centrally located”
Reviews.Author: KariBergen
Reviews.Content: Staying in a hotel by oneself for a week makes the quality of the accommodation important. Also, the many hours working in the evening makes one appreciate a decent wireless connection and access to quick, but decent meals. The Chateau Versailles offers decent-sized rooms, good temperature control (very important when temperatures range between 3C and -25C), quality breakfast, and a great location. Walking distance to many good museums, numerous high, medium and low end restaurants, good shopping and all transport options needed. Even better, just a 15-minute lovely walk to get to the lovely Royal Park, overlooking Montreal. Staff were helpful and pleasant, and the breakfast staff in particular were very attentive. I would have appreciated the receptionists looking up when I walked in from the cold, but this was a minor issue. Also, depending on who was in the next room, the walls felt a bit thin at times. The hotel is not shiny and new, but also not worn down in any way, but little reminders of age here and there. Finally, it took a long time (got a bit worried the first morning...) to get warm water in the shower, but with 25C below I guess that could be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a nice area of the city”
Reviews.Author: snorkel4fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau for a 3 night mini-break during the Christmas holidays. It was our second stay at the hotel. We had booked one of their Deluxe Rooms with Queen bed. Room was fine, nothing fancy but comfortable and clean, really what I would classify as a standard room. A smaller window looked out onto the side street. Our first night did not go so well as we had noise issues from the â€œguestsâ€� in the neighbouring room. The next morning we approached the front desk about our concerns. The front desk Manager â€œJohnâ€� was very helpful and arranged to move us to another room. He showed us a couple of other rooms in the hotel we could move to and made sure we were happy with the room before we moved. This I would say is one of the hotels strong points, the very helpful and friendly staff employed at this establishment. Always eager to help with restaurant reservations, tourist advice or addressing any concerns one might have. As previously mentioned this was our second time staying here. Our first visit we had one of the Deluxe King Fireplace rooms facing Sherbrooke Street. These rooms are much brighter and definitely make for a nicer stay. I would recommend one of these rooms if you can get a good deal on one. A bonus at this hotel is the complimentary continental breakfast. Very good and served in a charming little dining lounge. The historic old building itself has a very nice front faÃ§ade though just plain brick on the sides. As can be said about the structure of the building so goes the hotel, comfortable and decent but frayed a little on the sides yet still good value in a nice neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn”
Reviews.Author: SueSueT
Reviews.Content: Lovely heritage building in downtown Montreal, ideally situated for tourists. Close enough to walk to any downtown restaurant or other attraction and right on the bus line. Our room had a great high ceiling and was quite spacious, but the amenities were dated, especially the bathroom. The bathroom was very cramped with an old style tub and not much counter space for everything. Not luxurious at all and the floors in the corridor were uneven and creaked when you walked on them. Valet parking only, not too convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas shopping overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: lupin45
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law won tickets for a overnight's stay at The Chateau Versailles asking me to accompany her. I have always wanted to stay overnight at a hotel during the Christmas season, to take in some shopping and a movie so I jumped at the chance to do so. From the moment I entered this hotel on Sherbrooke Street in Montreal, Quebec Canada I was charmed by the place. The receptionist behind the desk was so friendly and it being Christmas the hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. I loved the high ceilings and the crown moldings were spectacular. Because this is an older building there was no elevator, so many stairs to climb not too good for anyone handicapped but of course the first floor is always an option . I loved the oak banister, not so sure about the paintings found them a bit strange and not to my taste. Our room was a bit disappointing as I was expecting one with a gas fireplace although the beds were comfortable and the room most spacious I found it lacked charm but the tickets were free after all. However next visit I will reserve one with a fireplace. We shopped took in The Ogilvy's window downtown Ste Catherine Street always magical, and the Christmas lights around the city were beautiful. The next morning after a good and peaceful night's sleep, we went down for a delicious continental breakfast the best one I ever experienced so much choice not the usual toast and jam. There was a huge selection of everything from cereal, cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cottage cheese with fruit salad, apple turnovers and so much more. The coffee was excellent, we sat in comfortable arm chairs beside the lit fireplace and the room was all tastefully decorated for Christmas. Overall experience would recommend this place highly, very pleasant experience worth checking it out instead of staying in a more modern hotel. However if modern is your choice the Chateau Versailles has a more modern accommodation directly across the street, The Chateau Versailles Meridian.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie R
Reviews.Content: This is really about the perfect hotel - it is affordable, in a beautiful old building with modern amenities, and you can open the windows to get fresh air. Great breakfast, great coffee. My night was not without its glitches (wireless down for a while, toilet initially not working) but these were addressed promptly by the staff. What's more, I left a dress behind and the staff found it and had it sent to me. The location is perfect. We did lots of shopping, and had great thai food and sushi nearby. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, "European boutique" hotel charm”
Reviews.Author: JilLeeH
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights in three rooms here...and we'd do it again. It was convenient to the subway and restaurants in walking distance. The decor in this lovely hotel was so beautiful. The ceiling in the 'parlor' beside the main lobby and the antique touches are very pretty. The floor in our room, in the hallways, and on the stairs was rather squeaky, so I hope we didn't disturb other guests, but it is kinda charming. Free wifi worked great. The breakfast was quite simple but very well orchestrated. Some of the carpet, and our bathroom, seemed a little tired and in need of some sprucing up, but everything was clean and functional. I have to say that the staff throughout the hotel were remarkable. Everyone greeted us with a smile. They made restaurant recommendations, transportation suggestions, and laughed with us as we experimented with our French and our touristy questions. It may have snowed during our trip, but it was wonderfully warm inside!

Reviews.Title: “C'est Tres Bien!”
Reviews.Author: missanabanana
Reviews.Content: I have visited many cities around the world and I can confidently say Chateau Versailles and the city of Montreal is my Favourite number 1 place to stay and visit. The hotel is located in a fantastic area of the city, everything is within walking distance. Very clean establishment, staff was friendly, informative and overall a wonderful crew. Room was great. Good size, and 'french' looking-in a good way! They offered breakfast in the morning which had a variety to choose from. Parking is limited and can be pricey. You can avoid this and go the frugal route by walking 30 seconds east of the hotel to the college campus and park in their lot for half the price in a secure lot. The city is filled with niche cafes, restuarants, bars, pubs, shops and even cater to the sports fanatics out there. It's a thriving city and I highly recommend people visit and take advantage of how amazing the city is. The hotel and staff is true to the whole french culture and a place worth staying at to get the whole french experience. I Love Montreal xo!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: kevin k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and were quite happy with our stay. The room was nicely decorated, the staff very friendly and helpful, good breakfast and a really great location for shopping and sight seeing. My only complaint is that the room was definitely starting to look a bit worn, carpets were a little stained and worn in in spots, and a little disappointed in the quality of the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: nameleftblank
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel during a short visit to a local university. The hotel has a touch of traditional European feel. The location is very convenient for downtown locations, and is a short walk from the Guy-Concordia Metro (subway). Check-in was friendly and quick, the room was very clean and comfortable, and the complimentary buffet breakfast was good. Internet service was free and reliable. On the downside, accessibility is limited by the lack of elevator; however, two cheery bellhops were on hand to help with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet simple elegance”
Reviews.Author: danavana
Reviews.Content: I "found" this property over 25 years ago. It is not the Ritz but a very good value in a superb location within walking distance to the shopping areas. An excellent but simple breakfast is offered and that adds to the quality of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of Europe in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lee-Anne
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Chateau and I enjoyed it even more than the first. The service was very friendly and the reception was helpful last year but this visit they seemed to outdo themselves. When we needed a cab at a certain time they arranged it, and when someone else took it, ( it was raining) the fellow on the desk ran out into the street to get us one so we could be on time for our dinner reservation. He then called the restaurant ahead to let them know we were on our way. Orders for extra pillows were delivered on immediately and any questions we had about the area or where to go, what to do etc. were handled very professionally and demonstrated a real knowledge of the area and what was available to us. The breakfast room as many before me described, is in a typical European style, in a room which was clean, quiet and peaceful. The restaurant is a short walk away from restaurants and shopping. The only time we took a cab was for a trip into the old section of the city because everything else was well within walking distance. There are some great restaurants right on Sherbrooke and the staff keeps a list of some they regularly recommend. The rooms are older, very charming. Ours had a nice little gas fireplace and sitting area. The bathrooms were quite clean and up to date but in keeping with the hotel style. If you do not like the old Victorian style then this may not be the place for you but we found it quite cozy. The only real thing that I would love to see them change is their bedding. It would be nice to see them lose the old blue bedspreads and move up to a duvet style set up which would be more comfortable and ultimately worlds more hygeinic. They could upgrade the sheet thread count as well. Would absolutely stay here again and I recommend it to anyone looking for a quieter stay that is still a walk away from the excitement of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “25 Years Later”
Reviews.Author: Frank I
Reviews.Content: Following a European vacation a few months before, my wife and I were married in the Fall of 1986. We wanted a pleasant honeymoon, but we couldn't bust the bank in view of our recent trip abroad. We drove through Ontario and Quebec and spent a few days in Montreal at this hotel. It was tastefully appointed, very comfortable, charming, and, as these things go, affordable. It's 25 years later, and I write from the hotel (which is now larger due to the acquisition of nearby properties). It is still a lovely stay. Although most of the criticism of the hotel is very positive, I have read some of the negative criticisms of the hotel on this board, and I simply wonder what people are looking for in a charming smaller hotel. "There are no elevators." Of course there aren't. This boutique hotel is carved out of half a block of beautiful stone townhouses, without destroying them. If you're worried about luggage, that's why God created porters. Ours greeted us promptly. "They have CRT TVs." Give me strength. What do you propose to do in Montreal though?. The rooms differ BECAUSE THEY HAVE CHARACTER. They are tastefully decorated by somebody who cared. Our room was spotless, the beds were comfortable, and the linens ample. Yes, our bathroom is small, but it has all of the essentials, in working order, and, again, I wish I had their decorator. There is art worth having in halls. Beneath the hall rugs, you will feel actual floorboards -- not girders in a skscraper. Thank God. You are in a great city, in a great neighborhood, in a room that feels more like a well-kept European hotel than the newest Sheraton in Omaha. Be thankful and grow up. A great boutique hotel. About the neighborhood. The Metro is two blocks away. There is a 24 hour convenience store a block away. After taking the Metro to the Old City and walking around quite a bit, we had dinner at a bistro near the hotel, which was great, and for which I would have paid twice in Washington, DC (home). They didn't make a big production out of it either. I'd rather stay here than in any chain-style hotel on the planet (yes, I know, its owned by the Meridian now, doesn't feel like it though). Frankly, I can't think of a place I've enjoyed more.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you are in France”
Reviews.Author: c_psych
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this quaint hotel, The rooms are small but very comfortable--although some of them are a bit worn. The included breakfast is served in a wonderful dining area and consists of very European fare -- cheeses, croissants, and breakfast meats. The ambiance includes classical music and the overall effect is to transport you to a European villa. The staff was very helpful and polite. The rates are reasonable but parking is an additional $26/ night. If you leave your vehicle on the street overnight you receive a $52 ticket. You can park at a nearby seminary for $9.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mstephens7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights for a conference. Room was comfortable but very small. Long steep flight of stairs greet travelers when they arrive on the sidewalk - so be advised you may have to carry your luggage up. Breakfast was very nice in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “It was lovely”
Reviews.Author: mary504
Reviews.Content: yes, the room was a little small...but the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was also quite nice. Would stay again. No elevator...so if that is an issue for you, please be advised. Walking distance to the Museum of Fine Arts and Crescent street, which is full of dining options, shopping, and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel it once was ... Expected much better”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: Chateau is not the hotel it once was. We stayed in a "suite" room, and it was marginal. The bed was very hard and uncomfortable, only 2 pillows and the sheets were thin and old and no duvet. The shower did not have much power, and very skimpy with only 2 body towels and 2 hand towels. Breakfast croissants were nice, but no fruit and the only eggs were cold hard boiled. I expected much better- especially for the rates!

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here several times.”
Reviews.Author: Alextalksbusiness
Reviews.Content: It continues to be well kept, excellent breakfast and nicely appointed rooms. Service is polite overall. A man who handles breakfast is a bit surly. The stairs can be a challenge, especially in winter. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “McGill parents' retreat”
Reviews.Author: TorontoAmc
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is a McGill student and we regularly come to Montreal to move her in or out of the various residences that she has been living in and to visit her. We love the Versailles for its character, its location, and the service. As mentioned by some reviewers, some of the rooms are small and require updating but the oneMs that we have been in recently are large and comfortable with room to move around, great bedding, and quiet location. The courtyard room that we had recently was a bit dark as it was facing North but we found it to be calm and restful. Service at the front desk is always pleasant and the breakfast is excellent. The choices are unusual for our palette but that contributes to the charm. I would wish for tea served in tea pots rather than in cups of hot water but that is a small matter as there is lots of food and variety. The location is excellent, within walking distance of McGill and the subway which we have used to travel to old Montreal and to the Botanical Gardens. One must explore more than just the student quarter after all. We have already booked our return on October 10th as we will be returning our daughter to school after the Thanksgiving weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but breakfast room traffic an issue”
Reviews.Author: Passagerare
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with our two sons (two rooms). Be aware that there's no elevator. Rooms were adequate but washrooms were small and the tub/shower almost claustrophobic. Rooms were quiet and reasonably well appointed (e.g. at least one easy chair, adequate closet space) and clean. If you're staying on a weekend, simply park on the street to avoid the valet parking charge and a 10 minute wait. While the breakfast (included) was ok, the breakfast room was no match for the number of clients. Rather than establishing a sequence for those waiting, staff seemed somewhat flustered and barely apologetic. They could, for example, have a simple coffee station in the foyer outside the breakfast room (four seats available there) so people could have a coffee while awaiting a table. Also, the French salon decor (soft seating and small tables) is not that practical to comfortably eat. The food was fine. At this price point (and less) there are better options, such as the Hotel du Fort, not that far away.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramaslamma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near guy cancordian St. Hotel is quite classy, but there aren't any elevators, rooms were too small, breakfast had few offerings. Moreover, the washroom didn't have a conditioner, so smell remained. Carpets needed repair, same goes with old tv and drawers, and mini bar, which were worned out. Plus note, the people were very helpful, service is pretty par over average.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: simply9
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel in June as part of a tour of Canada. This was a bit of a disappointment in some ways but a joy in others. We were allocated room 309 at the back of the hotel and found the room to be dark due to only one small window and being overlooked by another large building right outside. It as small, dated and could do with refurbishment. That siad, the staff were great and the breakfast was more than adequate, although we did find that finding somewhere to sit could ba a challenge at times. The hotel is placed close to Guy Metro station and the museum where we were lucky enough to see the Terracota army before it left. The underground shopping malls were very impressive and we made good use of them during the constant rain!. The Olympic stadium was a real let down as I was really looking forward to visiting it. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, the track has gone, its now an indoor concert venue and I appreciate that use has to be made of these structures but I hadn't expected to see such a change. In conclusion, Montreal is a great place to visit, but I would choose a different, more modern hotel with better decor and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Really outstanding service and an unexpectedly spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: boojerfam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Montreal and Quebec City. We stayed at the Fairmont Chateau Frontenac in QC, which offered many delights, but it's the Chateau Versailles I'll be raving about. From start to finish, the Chateau Versailles met all of our needs beautifully. Really superlative service at the front desk, for check-in, advice on dining, transportation, shopping, etc. Our family of four was given a room at the end of a hall (no elevators, but we knew that going in) that was really spacious, giving us room to keep and access our suitcases, and even had windows on two sides. Everything seemed fresh and recently updated. We very much appreciated the in-room safe (what is up with really fancy hotels that don't offer that?!) and the free wi-fi (again, hotels that charge $300 a night and then charge another $15 a day for wi-fi really chap my hide). A really fine breakfast with excellent croissants, egg dishes, cereals, etc was also offered and kept well stocked throughout. Will definitely recommend to friends and will hopefully get to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly and Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: mammageek
Reviews.Content: We came up to Montreal for a family reunion and stayed here for 3 nights using a Living Social certificate which represented about a 40% savings. As a Montrealer who has been in the US for the past 25 years, I can honestly say that this stay made me feel like I had come home and made me want to move back! There is an ambiance and charm in this very well kept old hotel. Breakfast was very good and served in the European style with coldcuts, cheeses, croissants, jams, cereal and coffee and team. Try and find that in any American hotel!! We had a junior suite on the second floor that overlooked the hustle and bustle of Sherbrooke. It was grand! We asked for extra towels and got them right away. Situated right on Sherbrooke, close to the Guy metro and within walking distance of Ste Catherines shopping area, the Musee D'Art, McGill & Concordia Universities, and the heart of the English night life on Crescent, Bishop and du Montagne. The subway system (Metro) is extensive and you can get almost anywhere without a car. Our first night we went to Chinatown for the best cantonese food we have ever had (Sorry, NY Chinatown food pales in comparison.) Look for hole in the wall places filled with Chinese people and you won't be disappointed. We also took the Metro to Mont Royal and walked over to St. Denis for dinner, stopping in at SAQ (Societe d' Alcool Quebec) to but a nice chilled bottle of wine ($16) for our dinner at l"Academie (Duluth and St. Denis. St Denis is at the heart of the "Latin Quarter" and is the place to wine, dine, dance and make new friends. (There is nothing Latin about it). From there we attended a terrific concert that was part of the Diverse/Cite festivities. Then we walked back to the hotel via Ste. Catherines. I am a bit biased but staying at the Chateau Versailles was lovely and close to everything we could want. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “An unfortunate stay.”
Reviews.Author: LaurenW23
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that all of the front desk staff at this hotel are the kindest people I have ever experienced at a hotel. Everyone was willing to help where they could, and were extremely polite and professional at all times. Now, with that being said, here is my review of the hotel itself. The hotel is in a very old building which I guess adds to it's charm if you're into that sort of thing - I personally am not. We were there during a busy weekend and the only 2 rooms available for booking at the time were either a standard room with a double bed, or for a small extra charge a "delux" room with a queen size bed. We opted for the delux room. Upon arrival, we were given a room on the 3rd floor, and as the previous reviews had mentioned, there is no elevator which was not a problem for us. We got to our room, and were shocked to see a run down, TINY hotel room, with orange walls, and two tiny windows barely letting any sunlight in. The carpet was stained, and there were coins under the bed from previous guests. The second night of our stay was when all hell broke loose. We came back from dinner at around 10:00pm, only to enter a sauna of a room. I litterally mean our room felt like it was on fire. We called the front desk, and were instructed to turn the thermostat to the oposite end (the hotter end) since this was an old building. At this point I would have tried anything. Sure enough, the room never cooled down. We went down to the front desk, and they sent someone up to attempt to fix it. They were unable to. We were given a big industrial sized fan, which was SO loud, it interrupted our sleep. Needless to say, we were very uncomfortable that night. Finally the next morning around 11:00am, cold air started coming out again, but our room was never as cool as it was the first night. On our third and final morning there, we were woken up by a loud banging noise in the pipes. We were actually very worried as it sounded like something was about to burst in the wall. Five minutes later there was a knock on the door and a maintnece man came barging in saying he needed to "fix the washroom." He then realized the noise was actually being caused by the washroom upstairs and took off to fix it. Not the most pleasnt thing to wake up to. This is rated as a 4 star hotel, and these instances are simply not acceptable for almost $200 a night. It's a shame because this hotel has 5 star service, but the building itself is old and tattered and really takes away from that. The hotel manager was prompt and efficient in contacting us, and that was very much appreciated. I have no intention of returning to this hotel again unless there are renovations made, and the AC system is updated. Paired with the excellent customer service, upgrades to the hotel would make it top notch.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best of the boutique hotels."”
Reviews.Author: PGWbird
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of my favorite things about Quebec, and Montreal in particular, are the boutique hotels. Unlike so many canadian cities that are dominated by chains, you can still find small hotels in Montreal that simply ooze character. The chateau Versailles is that kind of hotel. For about $150 you can spend a night in one of the hotel's lovely rooms - for a little more you can book a suite. I have stayed at the chateau Versailles a number of times and have been well accommodated every time. It is a boutique hotel assembled from three stately houses so the rooms are all different and often bathrooms are small, but the comfort and charm of the place more than compensate. The rooms are generally decorated with a cozy mix of traditional and contemporary furnishings, have minibars and nice amenities ( the crabtree and Evelyn soaps are a treat!). What really makes the stay for me, however, is the warm and very helpful desk staff (take a bow Diane!) and breakfast in the parlor (included in the cost of the room). The mix of pastries and frittatas served with hot coffee amid the hotel's collection of contemporary quebec art is the perfect start to a day of shopping, exploring or business. The location is a huge plus - for tourists the proximity to the metro, the musee de beaux arts, crescent street... What more could you ask for? You are right in the heart of the city and have friends at the desk ready to help you discover all that it has to offer. This is not an expensive, five star luxury hotel - but I find it to be a true oasis in one of canada's most vibrant cities.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Pyrrho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely maintained and in a very good location near downtown (galleries, McGill University, etc.). It is a nice change from all the bland modern hotels as well as from some overdone (and expensive) "boutique" hotels. The room we had was very comfortable and the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast was also very well done. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: azrtb
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed out stay at the hotel. Room was large and cleana nd the beds comfy. The location is very convenient for touristy things, the breakfast in the morning is a GREAT value. The hotel itself overall seemed a bit pricey but the staff and service were terrific. I would recommend for business travellers, or first time tourists.

Reviews.Title: “From a 24 year old's view- Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexAiello
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in town to see U2 in concert. I knew the trip would cost a little bit of money so I took a chance and used Priceline.com for the first time in my life and put in a $100 bid. The Chateau Versailles accepted and for weeks, I was agonizing over the decision: will it be close enough to downtown? Will we be away from all the action? We were both astounded at the location- you are only minutes away from Crescent Street and St. Catherine, the two streets that are notorious if you want to have a good time...and trust me they live up to their reputation. You are also a 2 minute walk from the Guy-Concordia Metro as well. Yes, you do have to pay for parking- but we didn't use the hotel parking lot, instead we used the parking lot just up the street from the Hotel (it's across from the Regency and overlooks a football field) and we only paid $12 a night. I thought it was a great and safe parking lot- I drive a 2006 Toyota Rav4 and the car was just as good as I left it. We stayed in Room 122 where we received a standard bed which was comfortable enough for two people to sleep in. The whole hotel has a very romantic atmosphere which makes the stay very enjoyable. Let's just say this: it's the only hotel I've stayed in that provided an intimacy kit. We were right next to the exercise room and saunas but we were so busy with our weekend that we did not get a chance to use it. As a young couple who likes to have a good night out, we arrived during the last 20 minutes of the free continental breakfast and were still served well. You will find cottage cheese, yogurt, croissants, chocolate croissants, cereal, granola, assorted cheeses (including my favorite- brie!), cold cuts, bread, wonderful fruit juices, and very fresh fruit- my partner and I take our fruit very seriously (we're dorks) and those had to be some of the best apples I've tasted. The coffee isn't that bad either! Now- I've got to say- the staff was incredible. Stephanie made us feel so welcome and was full of suggestions about where to go out in the city. Anytime we needed help with anything- places to see in the city, any question with our room- they were so quick to help us. They even let us use the fire exit when we checked out so we could easily take our bikes back to our car! We enjoyed the city of Montreal so much that even hours after we checked out and realized we forgot to print out directions back home (word to the wise: Verizon will charge you like crazy if you attempt to use your smartphone data plan outside the US, so you can't rely on your GoogleMaps app), Stephanie let us go back into the hotel's computer lab so we could print out directions back home. I've got to say- I don't know when I will be back in Montreal (I hope it's soon though!) but I would definitely stay in the Chateau Versailles again. Great location, great food, and great staff- you simply cannot beat it if you're looking for a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bonjour! Quite a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: pennytravelling
Reviews.Content: If you have never been to a European city, Montreal is a fantastic stepping stone holiday spot for Americans, and the Chateau Versailles is a great place to stay. The hotel is pretty easy to get to and is located directly on Rue Sherbrooke which is a main street in the city. There are great restaurants within a 15 minute walk, it is only a stroll to McGill University, and even closer to the MusÃ©e des beaux-arts de MontrÃ©al. There is a charge for parking, but so does everywhere in the heart of a city and the fee is not at all unreasonable and the valet was quick and friendly. The continental breakfast is delish &, well, quite continental, and our room was neat, clean and comfortable - The photos on their website are certainly accurate. And most of all, the staff was helpful, polite and always had a genuine smile with a bonjour or bonsoir. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel but needs serious updating”
Reviews.Author: globerunnerTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Versailles in April for two nights in Montreal. The hotel has been around for many years and I have stayed there before. The rooms are tired and the carpets are threadbare in spots. The bedspreads were also a little funky as they felt "old" as did the old balled wool blankets. Plumbing needs upgrading too as the shower could not get to a reasonable temperature. The location was perfect and the free breakfast a good perk. For the price we paid I felt the value was good, but for the this beautiful hotel to really shine, they need to at least paint and change the carpets/drapes and bedding. I will hesitate to stay there again unless I get the same ridiculously low price that I got last time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: bnj2377
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in early June 2011 on a trip to Montreal. I didn't actually realize until after we arrived that the hotel is apparently owned by Le Meridian. The hotel itself is quite charming - when you walk up to it from the street it has kind of an old world charm and a staircase leading up to the front door. The lobby is small but the hotel itself isn't terribly large so that's not unexpected. It actually looks more like a bed and breakfast than a hotel owned by a large conglomerate - a fact I personally liked. The decor made me think more of someone's comfortable home than a hotel. The hotel staffer who greeted us was very accomodating, offering suggestions on places to eat, sights to see, etc. There isn't a concierge but the front desk staff does the job. All of the staff I encountered spoke both English and French quite well (thank goodness because my french isn't exactly oustanding!). The hotel is 4 floors but....it has no elevator. The front desk staff offered to have someone help us up the stairs but we opted to do it ourselves since there we were only on the 4th floor (the lobby is actually on the second floor so it was only two flights). When we first arrived I thought the stairs wouldn't be a big deal and they weren't a problem per say but I have to admit that after walking around Montreal all day in the hot sun, I was tired at the end of the day and wishing for an elevator (but goodness knows I need the exercise). The room itself was nice - painted a warm orange with tasteful decorations and art. We had a queen size bed; the bathroom had a shower/tub combo and was lighty and airy feeling. Our room had a window overlooking the street but noise wasn't really a problem. The curtains were 'blackout' curtains but we did still find the room was a little bright in the mornings when the sun came out, even with closed curtains. If you are affected by light, I'd recommend bringing a sleep mask. The room had a safe, mini bar, the standards. The room also had a TV with local channels and move purchase options. The room did have air conditioning but I found it to still be a little warm, even on the coolest setting. It wasn't unbearable by any means but I did notice it at times. This could have been also because we were on the top floor - and the city was quite hot (in the 80's) the whole time we were there. There is no room service but there is a very good buffet style breakfast served every morning. It had frittatta, boiled eggs, assorted meats and cheeses, fruit, yogurt, croissants and other pastries, tea, coffee, juice, etc. The buffet comes with every room, per the front desk staff, so that's a nice plus in an expensive city. The hotel is situated right in downtown so it's very convenient for getting to everything. There are a number of restaurants and bistros in the area, plus there are two convenience stores within two blocks. The Guy-Concordia Metro station is two blocks away so that's the best stop to use for this hotel if you are taking public transport. The hotel offers free internet but there is also a computer and printer on the main floor if you don't bring a laptop. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel--lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: Travels_too_muchUtah
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Chateau Versailles and found it a perfectly adequate hotel for business purposes. It's got a terrific location, close to McGill and the Fine Arts Museum, and the staff are particularly helpful. The rooms are a bit dated--I had to laugh that my alarm clock included a CD player, but no place to plug in my iPhone--but the Wifi is free and reliable. I also thought breakfast was nice, and in included strong coffee! I think there are rooms with nice views, but mine on the 3rd floor was street level in the back of the hotel and I could see/hear people walking by. Do keep your curtains closed for privacy! Happily, it was never noisy or disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “All the amenities of a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: RajofMooses
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious and well-appointed room with classy finishes, nice bathroom, big bay window (that actually opened!), located in a charming historic building. It had all the in-room amenities of a chain hotel but with way more character. Friendly and helpful staff. For budget-minded travellers like me, I should point out that we stayed here because we found a great promotional price.

Reviews.Title: “A liitle gem in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: silversurferIreland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly staff..lovely tranquil safe location..nice breakfast..ideal location..minutes from Metro..loads of shops and restaurants within minutes walking distance..hotel is quaint with great character and newly decorated..a period building..all the staff were helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble..have to recommend..thank you Chateau..Montreal is a vibrant and exciting city..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zyla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau Versailles while visiting Montreal in February. We really enjoyed our stay. I would like to than Derek and Yvonne at the front desk for being extremely friendly,cordial and helpful. They both helped us with suggestions for restaurants, metro services and tourist attractions. I would also like to thank Sergio and John for helping us with the parking and our suitcases.The breakfast room staff were also very nice. Thanks.(Merci.) The hotel and room were very clean. The decor was beautiful combining modern and traditional styles. The room and bathroom were small but nice. The storage space was ample. There was a small closet , a dresser, a chair, a safe and an honor bar. There was free internet service near the lobby. The complementary breakfast was very good. The buffet contained coffee, tea, two types of juice, pastries( excellent brioche and croissants), toast, two types of quiche, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, meats, fruits and jams.. The breakfast room was decorated like an elegant parlor. The location was excellent because the hotel was located in a residential area within a block of the Guy-Concordia metro. I liked this location. It wasn't too busy and there were stores and restaurants right across the street. The only problem was that there are stairs at the entrance and no elevator. Make sure that you let the hotel know if you need parking. They have an indoor lot with valet parking but, it fills up. I would most definitely return to and recommend the Chateau Versailles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: Was booked there for a business stay: very well located near shops, restaurants...none of which I had time to enjoy but still noticed for future reference. Stairs to hotel might be steep for handicapped individuals and didn't look for a ramp...which might have been there. Lovely reception with great attention given to each guest. Breakfast is absolutely fantastic: buffet style in lounge next to small lobby and full of great offerings. Room was cozy but not for the claustrophobic: very small with limited desk space. However, perfectly fine for a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “stayed her before - loved it; after our 3rd stay - would not go back!!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyToronto_On
Reviews.Content: Oh my...what a difference between our first stay here 4 years ago, and then our last experience. We requested a "quiet room" and had to take all our luggage up the stairs, down the hall, and down some more stairs. The temperature was stifling - so we opened our windows at night, but they have wind chimes that make noise with the slightest wind, so that is what we heard all night long. We saw ants the first night and called the front desk. There were none the next day, but that night, there were more. We were moved into what we thought was an excellent suite with a fireplace, but our room was not cleaned the next day. When we called the front desk they said someone would show up between 5 and 6 pm for "turn down service" but no one came...but the real shock was when we awoke the next morning - my husband had small red bites all over his legs!! When we told the front desk lady she just shrugged and said that never happened before - well HELLO it happened NOW!!! To say we were disappointed with our stay would be to put it mildly. Next time, we will go to Sofitel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely European hotel. Elegant and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: WentworthLabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. We were very impressed with the service and the room was beautifully decorated. This is a charming hotel and the breakfast was great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - but not good”
Reviews.Author: FraserCarrie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. We had also tried the Omni Hotel - both of them were the same price. Sadly we stayed here after the Omni and for the same price this hotel paled in comparison. We picked the Chateau Versailles based on a recommendation from a colleague. The room was well appointed but it wasNOT quiet and for a boutique hotel I found the staff not overly friendly/helpful. Furthermore, breakfast was regularly over flowing with guests which is extremely problematic when you cannot eat due to space but need to get on with your day. So for the price, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyTravellerCA
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique boutique type hotel, that is such a great value considering what you get. It is creaky older building, and has lots of stairs, but I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for something besides a chain hotel or something to give you into an old Montreal fell. Breakfast was the best hotel continental breakfast we've ever had! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The area is close enough to the Metro and St. Catherine, but the only thing is the area around is very close to a University, so there's a lot of college students around and it gets very busy throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - this hotel is special”
Reviews.Author: FUBSYWOMAN
Reviews.Content: We were born in Montreal, but our parents have died, and this was the first time we had to stay in a hotel. We picked the Chateau Versailles because of its location, right on the edge of downtown, but in a mostly residential neighbourhood. The hotel is small and extremely charming. We had booked a regular room, but when we arrived, we were upgraded to a suite. This room had to have been the parlour of the original mansion. We had twenty foot ceilings, with two-foot carved floral cornices all around. In the centre was a huge carved rosette from which hung a brass and crystal chandelier. There were three tall windows in a bay window area, and the fireplace was a two story architectural wonder all on its own. The toiletries in the bathroom were Crabtree and Evelyn for goodness sakes. The "continental" breakfast was not the typical danish and coffee, but included cold cuts, hard-boiled eggs, frittata, cream cheese, yoghurt, cottage cheese, croissants, dainty chocolate danish, fruit juice, cereals, and the best coffee I have had in a long time -- and they serve it until eleven, which is a boon for night people. we felt so very well cared for, and would most definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We just keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: ErnestTraveler
Reviews.Content: There are many really good choices of places to stay in Montreal but this is truly our favorite and we just keep coming back. Location is right on Sherbrooke Street near the Musee des Beaux Arts but also within walking distance to many great restaurants as well. This hotel is an old converted mansion, actually two mansions connected, and will celebrate 100 years in 2011. I really recommend selecting the deluxe king room. You do get a nice fireplace which you may not really need during summer season, however, this room is the most beautiful for not too much more in price. A fairly decent breakfast is included in the price and online internet deals are quite desirable. Staff is friendly and front desk staff are very accommodating. Mostly, this is an old but very beautiful location in the old Westmount area but one that is very conveniently located near the downtown area. Beds and linens could be improved to the meet the higher standard and elegance of the building. The rooms are otherwise very clean. Some are on the smaller side but still all contribute to the charm of the hotel. We recommend parking your car at the nearby College de Montreal. This is a honor system parking space where you fill out an envelope in pencil to identify your vehicle and include $9 cash to cover your 24 hour parking. It is only about 2 blocks from the hotel, quite secure and super cheap compared to other options you might have in the area. We love, love, love this hotel. Again, there are so many great choices of places to stay in Montreal but we just keep coming back to this location, again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Alextalksbusiness
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there a few times. Rooms are indivudualy decorated, some small but OK. Quiet nights. Easy walk to downtown sites and restaurants and safer than driving. Breakfast is excellent. Stairs can be a challenge in the winter. Staff is friendly and helpful. On site parking is extra. Does not resemble a chain hotel, that is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RfromToronto
Reviews.Content: The reviews posted by others are quite accurate. The rooms and bathrooms are small. We arrived early and the front desk offered to store our luggage until we came back to check-in. There isnâ€™t an elevator, but there was always a porter/doorman/valet available to help with luggage. Iâ€™m not sure whatâ€™s with all the rave reviews of their breakfast, itâ€™s just a continental breakfast with cold cuts and cheeses, toast and jams, pastries, hard-boiled eggs, cold fajitas, cereals, yogurt and granola, coffee, tea and juices. The bathroom was small, very little counter space, and the shower was very difficult to adjust; i.e. scalding hot or freezing cold. But, with fine adjustments you are able to find an appropriate temperature. The hotel is very quiet and the beds were clean and comfortable. Definitely paid for a larger room because I saw one of the rooms being cleaned and the width of the room was just wide enough to accommodate a queen size bed. In addition, we overheard two sets of couples who booked on a hotel booking website requesting a room with two beds, being a small hotel with 60 rooms and having very few rooms with two beds, the hotel was not able to accommodate their request. We were travelling with a toddler who sometimes napped in the afternoon. We asked the front desk to let housekeeping know we were heading out for the morning and to clean the room. We appreciated that our room was cleaned right away which allowed us great flexibility in planning our afternoons; i.e. nap or sight-see. The air-conditioner in our room only cooled half the room. I overheard the front desk dealing with an air conditioner problem in a room that wasnâ€™t working properly which leads me to believe there are some rooms that have wonky air conditioner as mentioned in other posts. There are a couple of supermarkets 5 blocks away (Provigo and Supermarche PA). We liked Supermarche PA because it had better prices and had a more exotic selection.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, clean, quiet hotel that serves as a great home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBadger
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently spent six nights in Montreal. It was our first trip to this area. The staff was always very helpful & each day/night we were greeted with smiles. We appreciated their assistance with making dinner reservations one evening. We enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet which consisted of a choice of three cereals, juices (apple, orange & one other), toast w/ jams/peanut butter/butter, yogurt, meats & cheeses, pastries, apples/oranges. Served until 10:30am each morning, we always felt that our morning meal got our days off to a great start. The hotel is located on the edge of downtown. We would typically walk to our destinations each morning & take the Metro home at night. It's conveniently located near the Guy-Concordia station. Some reviews have complained about the lack of elevators & the size of some of the rooms. This hotel is located in a wonderful old building so it's no surprise that it doesn't have elevators. I would not let this discourage you. I am 6 months pregnant & was able to get around the stairs just fine. We had a standard room with a full size bed & it was just fine. Sure the room isn't huge but it's very typical of what you'll find in any large city (New York, London, etc.). The bed was comfortable, the room/bathroom were clean, it was quite- these are the important things to consider when looking for a hotel room. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our time in Montreal & stay at Chateau Versailles. We'd highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: RickURI73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in Montreal recently and stayed at the Chateau Versailles based on Tripadvisor reviews which proved to be very accurate. This is a great hotel to stay at if you want a quiet place and a good night's sleep as it seems to attract a more mature group of travelers, thus no drunks stumbling loudly to their rooms at 3am. Our room was very pleasant, all modern conveniences etc.... It is also conveniently located two short blocks from Metro Station Guy-Concordia. Breakfast was included in our package and was typical of a breakfast at a European hotel of moderate price with fruits, pastries, yogurts, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, etc..... The frittata might have been better served warm. The staff was friendly and helpful and gladly suffered our attempts to speak hgih school French. My only other criticism which wasn't worth complaining about or switching rooms was the the toilet seat in room 331 would not stay up when a guy needs it to stay up. It's a good thing I have two hands. The woodwork could be cut out a bit behind the toilet to allow the seat to stay up on it's own.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lissem
Reviews.Content: The decorations, rooms., common areas, and breakfast at Chateau Versailles reflected a romantic, charming ambiance. It was a very comfortable stay; however, we were on the first floor, and in the morning we could hear people walking in the sidewalks, and others trying to cut grass in front of our garden window. So if you are in a romantic trip, ask for a room upstairs. Other than that, the hotel was good. The breakfast buffet was really good: chocolate croissants, muffins, granola, fruits, juices, and strong coffee, and the location is close to downtown's shopping and business areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: LEH57
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Chateau Versailles exceeded expectations. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient; close to the Metro and easy walking distance to museums, restaurants and shopping. The breakfast buffet included with the room was excellent. The weather was hot, so we appreciated the air conditioning. We enjoyed our visit to Montreal very much.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations leave you in disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pupa1978
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary we booked a suite with fireplace for 250 a night. Upon arrival we were informed our room wasnâ€™t ready and if we can wait in the lobby. As I sat there waiting I saw housekeeping come and enter a room very close to the lobby. They spent most of their time in the door way of the room and after 5 minutes they informed the front desk they were done but they are waiting for pillows in French which I understand but do not speak. Therefore before they called my husbandâ€™s name to inform us the room was ready but my husband and I knew this semi cleaned room was ours before they called his named due to the fact we are not blind and understood their entire French conversation about the room not being ready on time. We entered and housekeeping told us she will be back with our pillows and finish making the bed, this took about 15 minutes for her to return! We had reservations at the Center Bell for 5:30 and we checked in after 3, so our plan was to take showers and start walking to the Center Bell and forget what just happened. Unfortunately the disappointment continued when I discovered the water pressure in the shower was a joke and the tub was clogged so I took a shower with water above my ankles. Trying to get the right temperature was a mission, either scorching or freezing while playing with the handle until it was a safe temperature. My husband unclogged the disgusting drain so we can at least have a normal shower when we return. We used the wash clothes and towels for drying and one for the floor since our shower curtain was cloth and allowed water to spill onto the marble floor, so we placed 1 of the 2 towels on the floor to avoid slipping. It was oddly colder than usual in Montreal during our visit so we turned up the heat with anticipation of arriving to a warm room upon return. The fireplace is solely for show and will warm you if you sit directly in front of it. The rugs need a shampoo and the walls need some spackle for all the cracks and fresh coat of paint or just wash the hand marks off the walls. DÃ©cor was beautiful but didnâ€™t distract me from the noise we heard from the lobby, front desk and the other visitors directly outside smoking under our window! This was a one night stay and I am glad because if we were planning a longer stay there would be no way I would stay here. When we arrived after our night out at 1am not one towel was replaced and the room was still cold. My husband discovered the next morning that the large windows do not fully close and that is why we were cold. The only heated area as I mentioned before was directly in front of the fireplace and the bathroom. I might have considered using the couch cushions and a blanket to sleep on the floor next to the fire place but as I said the rug was very noticeably worn out and filthy as was the couch. We woke up at 9am and got ready for breakfast in the dining area. I wish someone would have told us that cold frittata and slices of turkey is what to expect. There was not much left at 9:30am and no seats. I was greeted by staff who said Bon Jour and I replied Good Morning and without asking he explained we cannot return after we leave and get more food! When he saw the puzzled look on my face he explained that some guests try to eat the FREE breakfast from the time it is served until 11am and laughed while looking around at other guests expecting them to find this funny as well! I smiled and walked away confused wondering why he felt the need to say something like that to me? I feel it is insulting and unnecessary bit of information. For the price I paid for this room compared to the prices I read in these reviews I apparently paid too much and should have gotten my left over cold breakfast delivered to my room which technically was not far from the dining area and lobby so it wouldnâ€™t have been a long walk for the staff and the he can properly ensure I wasnâ€™t going to steal extra free food. After being embarrassed we found two seats and sat down attempting to enjoy what I could and within minutes the same person who told me no second helpings asked if he could take our plates and I felt rushed! Check out was at 12 and we left way earlier because I just didnâ€™t want to sit in a cold room with a TV that should have been a flat screen. The remote control buttons were either dirty or worn out due to how old the TV is. Pictures are deceiving on the website and the people who love this hotel that is wonderful and I guess that only means I need to lower my expectations. Where I come from paying 250 a night gets you a fantastic room in the tri-state area, one that my husband doesnâ€™t have to play plumber. It would have also been nice if the front desk told us just about everything is closed on Sunday. The only answers I got as far as activities outside the hotel are maybe this and maybe that, which isnâ€™t comforting when you are visiting for the first time. Since we walked in the door I had this sense of an atmosphere that was poorly managed and I felt not mentioning the horrors of my stay would save me the empty Iâ€™M SO SORRY TO HEAR THAT statement which wouldnâ€™t alter my experience! I was obviously right because according to other reviews not much gets done when you voice your concerns here. With that said, I do not plan on returning to this hotel or recommending it to anyone that likes to be treated like a human or luxury along with cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: lily_2486
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chateau Versailles for 2 nights, I arrived at the hotel before check in and since my room was not yet available they were more than happy to store my bags and give me a map and directions to go out a explore Montreal. My room was huge twice the size of most hotel rooms with large bay windows looking out to the street. The Chateau Versailles has all the little luxuries a boutique hotel should with designer toiletries and big comfy beds. I loved the Lindt chocolate on the pillow at turn down and the weather forecast for the following day. Breakfast was one off the best complimentary continental breakfasts I have seen in a long time. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great end to our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: VLBJhb
Reviews.Content: The number one problem with this hotel is that I booked a queen bed but was supplied a double. The matress supplied was old and left both my partner & I with such bad back pain that we slept on the floor the fourth night out of sheer desperation. The room was long and narrow but would have been quite characteristic bar the bed! The hotel staff were not very helpful. We enquired as to the Quebec City tour and the lady manning the reception desk did not mention that it was only running Weds and Sats. I expect my hotel to advise me on such things. They also could not seem able to recommend a restaurant?! The continental buffet breakfast was good though and the location was not bad. It seems more aligned to business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: deza
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights(02 to 06/ April) in Chateau Versailles and found it this very charming. I have choosen it because of the Tripadvisor's reviews and totally agreed with them. Great location, 2 blocks from the subway station and from the Museum of Fine Arts Montreal. The staff is kind and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, roomy & comfy”
Reviews.Author: houliganski
Reviews.Content: Chateau is a great place to stay, if you are looking for inexpensive accommodation close to the subway and downtown. The rooms are a bit small, but the bed is comfortable. We stayed in 333 and it was overlooking the La Meridien and the street. The front desk girl Marina was very pleasant and polite. The breakfast was great every morning as well as coffee. Thanks for hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “has a more home feel to it then hotel”
Reviews.Author: MISSPICO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during grand prix has last minute obligations in montreal for a fairly long stay , the city of course was booked out so I did find Chateau versailles luckily.It is in a wonderful location , actually one of my favorite locations in downtown montreal .It was pricey at the time 400 a night but that was due to low vacancy in the city at the time. That was a bit steep eventhough. I had arrived and true there is no elevator but there is a sister hotel across the street and the conceirges from there still make sure to carry your luggage and bags if needed. There is a fairly long flight of stairs to go up just to enter the hotel so I am unsure it is handi capp friendly , that would be something if needed to find out to see if there is handicapp wheel chair access to get inside the hotel to be able to still be accoidated for on the first floor:) Otherwise I did not really eat inside the hotel has there was way to much wonderful foods to try out even in the neighbourhood, so I cannot comment on this. The hotel was still clean with up to date bedding and rooms that felt like home .The chateau even appears like home from the outside of it . It was different but I did enjoy the aspect of it feelingling like home .

Reviews.Title: “The Chateau and Genevieve Made Our 5th Anniversary in Montreal the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Mambo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided last minute to go to Montreal for our 5th Anniversary. We found an excellent price for this cozy property on the web, and decided to give it a try. Our accommodations were wonderful! Each breakfast was delicious, with many different things to choose from, and the Chateau was exceptionally quiet and in a great location for walking or public transportation! All of the staff were great, but one in particular really made us feel at home. Genevieve at the front desk rocked! She checked us in and assisted with making recommendations and reservations immediately at Au Pied de Cochon, O Noir, and Schwarz's, (all 3 were fabulous local food!) practically planning our gastronomic itinerary for the whole trip! I highly recommend that anyone visiting consult with her recommendations! Versailles really was a very romantic little place to stay. We're looking forward to coming back as soon as we can. My only recommendation would be that they consider wireless!

Reviews.Title: “nothing but good things to say about this place”
Reviews.Author: nlmartinez
Reviews.Content: Upon walking in, we were warmly welcomed by the staff. She offered us several helpful maps and sightseeing options, and mentioned that admission to the Architecture museum was free with our keycards. Other staff members were just as helpful - one recommended and called in our reservation for a terrific French bistro a block away. The room itself was quite comfortable, and very clean. Fresh towels were placed in the bathroom daily, and though the bathroom itself wasn't enormous it was still large enough for two people to get ready for the day. Bed was comfortable, sheets were clean and the pillows were soft. Breakfast was included with our stay and consisted of a sensible spread of croissants, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, fruit salad, cheese, and cold meats (salami, ham). Seating available in the boudoir as well as the lobby and area near the stairs. The location itself is fantastic - it's not on the busiest of streets but only a few blocks away from Rue St. Catherine and the Guy-Concordia Metro station (the entrance on St. Mathieu is closest). For those that like exercise, there is a Bixi station half a block away on Sherbrooke St. Highly recommended. Will definitely return here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelernow
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews of Chateau Versailles and thought we knew what to expect. We did upgrade our room upon arrival, and even then we thought it was a value. The staff was very helpful and we called upon the front desk and concierge daily with "touristy" questions. They were always helpful and patient with us, and in one instance saved us a lot of money on tickets to a festival with some "home town local" information. The rooms were clean, the breakfast buffett was flavorful and filling and the location was close to the metro and many good resturants. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and would like to return again, myself.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: stillcomingngoing
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Chateau during September. Let me start by saying that if you are looking for a luxury hotel with all the amenities, then don't stay here and end up giving it a one star rating because it was not up to your 'requirements.' But if you are looking for a somewhat unique place, and can tolerate a few inconveniences, such as no elevator, then this is an option you should consider. We were very satisfied with our stay. We had a nice room on the third floor, a room that was not in the cookie-cutter category of most hotels. The bathroom was a bit small, but must be considered within the structure of the building. I would also comment that the carpet appeared somewhat worn. Other than that, we had all we needed. I had no problems with the front desk staff. I did not find them to be aloof or snooty, as some others have commented. In fact, when we checked in they actually advised us of the $7 parking down the street as an option to their own $24 a night fee. Our check-in and check-out both went smoothly, and the bellman was on the spot to handle our luggage and take care of our vehicle. With respect to our vehicle, once we checked-in, we left it unused for the duration of our stay. The subway stop is a short 2 blocks from the hotel, and in fact you can catch a bus right outside the hotel which will take you the 2 blocks down to the subway station. Once you get to the subway, so much of the city instantly becomes accessible to you. Previously the Chateau charged for wireless internet. Happily they have recently changed that policy, and it is now free. Also included in the room price is a breakfast offering a nice selection of foods and set up in a lovely relaxing room. In short, we were happy with our choice and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the negative reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kharlie
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at Chateau Versailles, Sept. 18 to 20, 2009. Even though we had one of the small, "cheaper" rooms, on the first floor, it was lovely! Cute, clean, funkily decorated, good quaility towels and toiletries! The staff were very friendly and helpful, we were charged accordingly, and enjoyed the free breakfast provided. If you are looking for the cookie cutter nature of a large hotel, this hotel is NOT for you. However, if you like art, antiques, and good service, enjoy the Chateau Versailles! Karla and Grant Hamilton and Toronto, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: VBSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chateau Versailles for three nights in early September, having booked the hotel back in March. I checked reviews of the hotel when we booked it and it sounded great. Just before we left on our trip, I checked the reviews again and became concerned due to some negative reviews. Our experience wasn't perfect, but we would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. We arrived by car around 5pm on September 2nd and it was a pretty warm day. We were initially assigned room #206. The room was warm so we cranked up the AC, only to find the room temperature didn't change. We called reception and they sent an engineer who told us we didn't have control over our room temperature... it was controlled by other rooms. We didn't quite understand that, but were offered a different room, which we accepted. The room was a bit smaller, but the AC worked. Our room was on the second floor facing the street. Noise was not a problem. (There is no elevator in the hotel.) Our room had a nice marble bathroom, comfortable queen bed, soothing decor. If you drive to Montreal, there are two options for parking a car: valet parking at Le Meridien across the street for $24/day, or public outdoor parking just down the street for $7/day. We chose the latter and left our car there for 3 nights. The breakfast buffet is exceptional: quiche, hard-boiled eggs, croissants, pain au chocolat, ham, cheeses, breads, juices, cereals, coffee and tea. If there was one thing we weren't thilled with, it was some of the front-desk staff in the afternoons/evenings. Our first day there were two young women, (Sara was one of them) who were great and very helpful. The other two afternoons there were also young women at the front desk. They seemed preoccupied with things other than helping us and didn't know a thing about local restaurants. Yvonne was at the front desk each morning. She is knowledgeable and helpful. Only 2 blocks from the metro, we liked the location of Chateau Versailles because it's n not in the middle of a touist area. Free Wi-Fi that worked perfectly. If you want large rooms, a concierge at your servive at all times, an elevator, and everything as perfect as possible, you probably don't want a boutique hotel, so don't stay here. If you enjoy boutique hotels, I highly recommend Chateau Versailles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel in Beautiful Montreal Near McGill University”
Reviews.Author: George083
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from one week at the Chateau Versailles in Montreal. We went to Montreal for the first time to sightsee and attend the Rogers Cup Tennis Tournament. The Chateau Versailles turned out to be the perfect choice for us. The positives: Close to subway; Nice breakfast in the morning which was included in the room price; Incredibly courteous and helpful staff members, including Yvonne, Issam and Fernanda at the front desk; a small, quaint hotel (we were glad we didn't stay in a high rise hotel); free internet access from the community computer, which was usually open when I needed it. Negatives: If you don't like stairs, this isn't the right hotel for you; Paying a low price like we did probably means you'll get a small room with a tiny bathroom. If you can't handle that, don't book a low-priced room. Because of a small water leak in our small room, we were kindly moved to a larger room facing Sherbrooke Street. The room was fantastic, very roomy and classy. While the noise wasn't a big problem, the management should invest in triple-pane windows for the front of the hotel, which would cut down on street noise considerably and save on energy costs. All-in-all, we had a great stay and can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SSjai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal at the Chateau Versailles over the July 4th weekend. The hotel is clean and nice and has an old world charm. After we checked out and returned home, we got an additional bill for 75 dollars. When we called to check on it, the Manager told us that we drank 1 bottle of red wine, 1 Bailleys and some other assortment of liquor from the room!! It was unbelievable! My husband and I do not drink and to be charged for this was ridiculous. We tried explaining it , but the guy was so rude and refused to listen. He even claimed to have found the "bottles" in the trash! There is no way we can prove it. Looks like whoever came in to clean the room after we checked out must have swiped the drinks. It was unpleasant and very unfair that we have to pay for something we never used. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. SInce you dont want to go home after your trip to hear that you need to pay extra for somethig you never used!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somwhere else”
Reviews.Author: corsie
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights and was very disappointed ffrom the start. Right on busy main road and our room was very small and very noisy. Booked superior room so would not have like to see standard room! Room VERY dark with dark coloured walls and bedcovers. A lick of cream paint and new bedcovers would work wonders. Complained and asked for room move which was accommodated. 2nd room better but still dark and not very inviting. Very old building with lots of stairs and no elevator so with lots of luggage and no porter a real nuisance. Breakfast was good and served in nice room however not a lot of space and on our last morning we were informed that an early breakfast (7am) would not be possible. Location is OK close to Museum of Fine Arts and some bars/restaurants and metro. However during our stay we found much nicer locations (Old Town, Plateau) and would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “"Tired" Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YVRTraveller0
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Montreal for business 3-4 times a year over the last 10 years. Having stayed at other hotels in the past, I was looking forward to staying at the Chateau Versailles for it's "boutique" atmosphere. Perhaps my expectations were too high, but I was disappointed overall. Although charming in appearance at first glance, after taking a closer look, I would say the hotel overall looks "tired", and could use a bit of a facelift. I was travelling with a sizeable group from my company, and more than a few of us asked to be transferred over to the Meridien hotel across the street after the first night - a request which was fulfilled by the hotel staff. My main reasons for moving were as follows: My room was small and dark. I had requested a king sized bed, ended up getting a double. The bed was very uncomfortable, with a very, very firm mattress that tended to "pop-up" on the opposite end, when you sat down on the corner of it. The bed cover was old and worn, and looked dirty. The sheets, blanket and pillows were all reminiscent of a cheaper motel, and not a boutique hotel. There was no full length mirror, and the "armoire" in the corner was creaky, cheap looking, and had a door that wouldn't close. By contrast, the bathroom was more or less ok. The shower head and drain were very old and loose, but the rest of the bathroom looked completely new. My main issue with the bathroom was that there was almost no counter space to put any of my things on. A little shelf would have been nice. Since the building is old, there is some noise expected. The floors are creaky, and you could hear everyone walking on the floor above. The common areas of the hotel are quaint, and the breakfast room was lovely, with a very nice continental breakfast served. I didn't have much interaction with the staff, other than when I asked to be moved. They were friendly and efficient in accomplishing that. Interestingly though, they didn't ask me why I wanted to move. I would have thought that the hotel would want to know why someone asks to be moved 1 day into their 4 night stay. The rate my company paid was $170 per night, and I would definitely not come back again at this rate. I believe it is very poor value for that price. If you can get a rate closer to $100 per night, I would say you're getting what you paid for. I will not be staying here again in future. For the same rate, you can get a very comfortable bed at the Meridien across the street or the Delta on Avenue President Kennedy.
